title: Tomotaka Fukagawa
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Fukagawa was born in <a href="Muroran%2C%20Hokkaido">Muroran</a> on July 24, 1972. After graduating from <a href="Kokushikan%20University">Kokushikan University</a>, he joined newly was promoted to <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club, <a href="Cerezo%20Osaka">Cerezo Osaka</a> in 1995. He played many matches as forward from first season. In 1998, he moved to newly was promoted to <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club, <a href="Hokkaido%20Consadole%20Sapporo">Consadole Sapporo</a> based in his local. Although he played many matches until 1999, his opportunity to play decreased for injury from 2000. In 2002, he moved to <a href="Mito%20HollyHock">Mito HollyHock</a>. He retired end of 2002 season.
